definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Never had the Federalists been so popular.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦黨人從未受過這種禮遇。

sentences.english: The new Embassador was received with solemn ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 新大使受到了隆重的禮遇。

sentences.english: Heart-warming Christmas rewards are within reach!
sentences.chinese: 窩心聖誕禮遇，就在眼前。

sentences.english: To the United States is also a number one would be given the cold shoulder to.
sentences.chinese: 一個球王到了美國也是會遭到禮遇的。

sentences.english: Thank you in advance for your consideration and  courtesy.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙閣下的關懷和禮遇，至此表示感謝。

sentences.english: The visiting head of state was given the honour of a twenty-one salute.
sentences.chinese: 來訪的國家元首領受了二十一響禮炮的禮遇。

sentences.english: Conkling charged that President Garfield had failed to observe the policy of " Senatorial Courtesy" .
sentences.chinese: 康克林職責加菲爾德沒有遵從參議員禮遇政策。

sentences.english: His executive position entitled him to certain courtesies rarely accorded others.
sentences.chinese: 他的行政職務使他享有某種極少給予別人的禮遇。

sentences.english: You see that your wife is respected in the street.
sentences.chinese: 你會發現你的妻子在街頭也會禮遇有加。

definition: to return from a rewarding journey
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
(originally) to provide assistance/(more recently) to show one's support (for a singing idol etc)
